subject: Timely processing of Access Permission Cases.
text: MRay <4q rTHRf9iferazrut (7ew5 4Rdev &1 TTHri HRT4, MRG FRGTR) National Highways Authority of India (Ministry of Road Transport and Highways, Government of India) Ta4a TA 6fl-5 Q 6, #aer-10, ERAT, 7 fcvlt 110 075 G-5 & 6, Sector-10, Dwarka; New Delhi-110075 3M/Phone 91-11-25074100 25074200 NHAI/Policy Guidelines/Access Permission/2023 Policy Circular No. 14.24/ 2023 dated 13th July, 2023 {Decision taken on E-Office File No. NHAI/HO/AccessPermission/2023 (Comp. No. 210429)} Sub: Timely processing of Access Permission Cases. Ministry vide letter No RWINH-33032/01/2017-S&R(R) dated 26.06.2020 and subsequent amendments has issued detailed guidelines for grant of access permission to Oil Retail Outlets and Private Properties: The   guidelines   provide for processing of application in the "online system" only and it shall be completed within 45 days, excluding timeline for submission of clarification in response to Authority's comments. 2 However, it is observed that in general the access permission cases are being inordinately delayed at PIU/RO level resulting in public displeasure and complaints The issue has been viewed very seriously and the Competent Authority has decided that henceforth all the access   permission cases shall be monitored by NHAI HQ: As such following SOP which should be followed in each access permission case: Immediately on the receipt of the access permission proposal, the basic details of the proposal shall be entered in Datalake Module without fail. It shall be personal responsibility of the concerned PD to enter the details of the proposal in Datalake_ (ii) PDs are advised to conduct joint site Inspection on a fixed date with AE/IE and Concessionaire with applicant to avoid multiple site visits by each: (iii) All the observations by the PD shall be sent to the applicant oly once. Upon recommendation by PIU, additional observations if any, shall also be communicated by RO only once. (iv) All the correspondences like observations raised by PIU/RO, recommendation to RO, of permission /rejection by RO should be invariably uploaded in Datalake Module by PIU for monitoring of the access permission cases: Small corrections in drawings, minor safety improvements etc may be added by PIU/RO themselves instead of returning the file to the applicant: (vi) The Ministry is already in process of making the entire process paperless. As such PIUs/ ROs are advised to carry out   entire process   online preferably without accepting the physical file: Contd_2I - '9 ? " 9 NHAL along grant
